PLACEMENT SERVICE, MAY, 1955: PAGE 2
May 8* Young ambitious veteran, married, one child, studio operations graduate
of Television Workshop, seeking position on television technical staff. Can
operate television camera, video, audio, turntables, mike boom, projectors and
remotes. Photograph and resume on request. Will relocate anywhere in U. S.
May 9. Available for immediate employment. Young man, 35, wants position in
educational TV. Equipped by training and experience to handle wide range of
problems. Can fit into any organization. Looking for opportunity to combine
creative ability with technical know-how in educational field.
May 10. AGE 30, SEEK RADIO-TV POSITION IN N.Y, BA AND MA DEGREE. EXPERIENCE IN
COMMERCIAL WRITING AND TEACHING. HAVE GOOD KNOWLEDGE OF MUSIC, THEATRE AND LIT.
May 11. Experienced in producing and M.C.’ing educational telecasts for youngsters
and adult audiences. Degrees in music and communications. Competent pianist
and conductor. Desire position in TV production, preferably with on-camera work.
May 12. Former Program Director of WNYC, and Campaign Director for San Antonio
Council for Educational Television wants management and/or program director’s
position with educational television station. Has, in addition to experience
in educational broadcasting and televising, five years programming experience
with commercial stations, including WNBC, New York; and comprehensive experience
in community organization for educational television. Location not important;
furthering of career in educational television is. Would consider job as
Campaign Director for initial community efforts to secure capital funds.
May 13. I have been thoroughly trained in radio and television. My radio ex¬
perience includes announcing, programming, and management. Two educational
programs I produced received national citations from the Ohio Institute, I am
looking for a challenging position with an organization interested in or active
in television.
May 14* Production, Script, Research. Versatile young woman with commercial
station and network experience in informational and cultural programming. A.B,
with Distinction, Cornell.
May 15. Experienced manager with six years of teaching in college and four years
commercial experience on the executive level desires more challenging position.
Age-35, married, doctoral candidate, and can furnish better than average references.
May 16. Available at once: Man, age 50, Ph.D, degree, family, with background
of successful experience in university teaching (music) and in commercial broad¬
casting. Teaching included fifteen years orchestra and band conducting as well
as various courses in music education and instrumental music. Broadcast exper¬
ience last ten years as director of education and research for leading mid-west
station. Have worked closely with school and college officials in planning educa¬
tional series, radio and television. Position desired in educational broadcasting
with possibility of special cooperation with music department.
May 17. All phases of television and radio experience, 16 years as writer,
director, producer, news writing and management. Experience in building, operating,
managing 14 radio stations simultaneously. Advisor, teacher, author of texts
on radio production-directing. Have had technical training and am an FCC license
holder, 3rd class; experience in copyright and clearance problems, wide musical
background, publicity, promotion and public relations background. Phi Beta Kappa
and currently pursuing doctorate degree in mass media of communications at
